title: Protein-packed breakfast: 7 amazing benefits to fuel your day - Hindustan Times
summary:
7 Amazing Benefits of a Protein-Packed Breakfast

Publication Date: December 27, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

A protein-rich breakfast fuels your body, boosts energy, and sets the tone for a productive day! This article outlines seven key benefits of starting your day with protein.

  • Feel fuller for longer, curbing hunger and reducing calorie intake later in the day.
  • Boost energy and focus by stabilizing blood sugar levels.
  • Increase thermogenesis to burn more calories and manage weight effectively.
  • Support muscle recovery and growth with essential amino acids.
  • Reduce cravings for sugar and fat by stabilizing blood glucose.
  • Lift mood with amino acids that boost serotonin and dopamine levels.
  • Improve heart health by lowering LDL cholesterol and increasing HDL cholesterol.
“Protein keeps you satisfied, curbing hunger and reducing calorie intake later in the day.”

In conclusion, incorporating protein into your breakfast can significantly enhance your energy levels, mood, and overall health.
newTitle: 7 Amazing Benefits of a Protein-Packed Breakfast

title: 4 side-effects of olive oil that you must know - The Financial Express
summary:
4 Side-Effects of Olive Oil That You Must Know

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Financial Express

This article explores the potential side effects of olive oil, despite its known health benefits.

  • People allergic to olives should avoid all olive-derived products to prevent acute allergic reactions.
  • While olive oil has many health benefits, excessive consumption may lead to digestive issues.
  • Olive oil can interact with certain medications, affecting their efficacy.
  • High amounts of olive oil can contribute to calorie excess if not consumed mindfully.
"Olive oil helps in improving the cardiovascular system."

While olive oil offers numerous health benefits, awareness of its side effects is crucial for safe consumption.
newTitle: 4 Side-Effects of Olive Oil That You Must Know

title: Bird flu virus shows mutations in first severe human case in U.S., CDC says - The Hindu
summary:
Mutation Detected in First Severe U.S. Bird Flu Case, CDC Reports

Date: December 27, 2024
Source: The Hindu

The CDC announced mutations in the hemagglutinin gene in the first severe bird flu case in the U.S., detected in a Louisiana resident. The outbreak remains low risk for the general public.

  • First severe bird flu case reported in the U.S. occurred in Louisiana.
  • The patient is over 65 years old and has severe respiratory illness.
  • Infection caused by D1.1 genotype, not the B3.13 genotype.
  • Mutations are rare but have been reported in severe infections in other countries.
  • No person-to-person transmission identified from this case.
The risk to the general public from the outbreak has not changed and remains low.

This finding highlights the necessity of monitoring mutations in the bird flu virus and underscores the current low risk to public health.
newTitle: Mutation Detected in First Severe U.S. Bird Flu Case, CDC Reports

title: The Portfolio Diet does much more than just control cholesterol - Health shots
summary:
7 Benefits of the Portfolio Diet for Cholesterol and Blood Sugar Control

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Health Shots

The Portfolio Diet is a plant-based eating plan designed primarily to lower cholesterol levels while also providing numerous other health benefits.

  • Reduces LDL cholesterol effectively.
  • Lowers the risk of cardiovascular diseases.
  • Promotes sustainable weight loss through fiber-rich foods.
  • Improves blood sugar control and reduces the risk of type 2 diabetes.
  • Reduces systemic inflammation with anti-inflammatory compounds.
  • Improves gut health by promoting beneficial bacteria.
  • Enhances overall nutritional intake and supports a healthy lifestyle.
“A dietary portfolio compared with low-saturated fat dietary advice resulted in greater LDL-C lowering during 6 months of follow-up.”

In conclusion, the Portfolio Diet not only helps in lowering cholesterol but also enhances overall health, making it a well-rounded eating plan for many individuals.
newTitle: 7 Benefits of the Portfolio Diet for Cholesterol and Blood Sugar Control

title: 150 minutes of weekly aerobic exercise key to reducing waist size and body fat: Study - CNBCTV18
summary:
150 minutes of weekly aerobic exercise key to reducing waist size and body fat: Study

Publication Date: March 2024 | Source: JAMA Network Open

A recent study reveals that engaging in aerobic exercise for at least 150 minutes a week significantly aids in reducing waist size and body fat among overweight and obese adults.

  • The study reviewed 116 trials with nearly 7,000 participants.
  • While 300 minutes a week showed the highest reduction in body weight and waist circumference, best improvements in body fat percentage were observed at 150 minutes.
  • Aerobic exercises, including running and cycling, enhance heart rate and oxygen delivery to muscles.
  • 30 minutes a week provides modest gains, whereas 150 minutes leads to clinically important changes.
  • The greatest reduction in body fat percentage was over 2% with 150 minutes of aerobic training.
Aerobic exercise training at least 150 minutes per week at moderate intensity or higher may be needed to achieve clinically important reductions in waist circumference and measures of body fat.

This study emphasizes the effectiveness of sustained aerobic exercise, specifically 150 minutes a week, in promoting better health and mitigating the risks associated with obesity.
newTitle: 150 Minutes of Aerobic Exercise Helps Reduce Waist Size and Body Fat: Study

title: Kosovo detects first monkeypox case after man returns from Africa - Deccan Herald
summary:
Kosovo Reports First Case of Monkeypox After Return from Africa

Published on: 27 December 2024, Source: IST

Kosovo health authorities have confirmed the country's first case of monkeypox in a man who recently returned from Africa. The patient is stable and being monitored.

  • A 30-year-old Kosovo citizen was hospitalized after returning from a west African country.
  • Symptoms reported include fever, chills, and skin changes on the face and hands.
  • All contacts of the patient have been traced for additional precautionary measures.
  • The WHO has identified monkeypox as a public health emergency due to ongoing outbreaks.
  • Monkeypox generally presents as a mild viral infection.
The WHO declared an emergency in August when monkeypox spread from the Democratic Republic of Congo to neighboring countries.

Health authorities are urging public awareness and adherence to infection control measures following this first reported case.
newTitle: Kosovo Reports First Case of Monkeypox After Return from Africa

title: Diabetes in cats, dogs: symptoms, treatment, and how to ensure they remain healthy - India.com
summary:
Diabetes in cats, dogs: symptoms, treatment, and how to ensure they remain healthy

Publication Date: N/A
Source: India.com

Diabetes isn’t just a human concern—it also affects our beloved pets. Dogs and cats can develop diabetes mellitus, a condition that affects how their body processes glucose. With proper care, monitoring, and early intervention, pets with diabetes can still live happy and fulfilling lives.

Key Points:

  • Diabetes in pets can manifest as excessive thirst, frequent urination, increased appetite, and weight loss.
  • Types of diabetes include Type 1 (common in dogs) and Type 2 (more common in cats).
  • Early diagnosis through blood tests and urine analysis is key to effective management.
  • Treatment involves insulin therapy, dietary changes, and regular exercise.
  • Pet owners play a crucial role in monitoring and managing their pets' diabetes.
"With the right support, diabetes doesn’t have to be a barrier to a fulfilling life for dogs and cats."

While diabetes in pets is a serious condition, it is manageable with proper care, medication, and lifestyle changes.
newTitle: Understanding Diabetes in Cats and Dogs: Symptoms, Treatment, and Care Tips

These 10 habits make perimenopause worse, time to stop now - Moneycontrol
summary:
These 10 habits make perimenopause worse, time to stop now

By Namita S. Kalla | December 27, 2024

Hormonal shifts during perimenopause can be managed better by avoiding these 10 triggers, which worsen symptoms.

  • Tobacco use accelerates bone loss and cardiovascular damage.
  • Too much caffeine intensifies anxiety and disrupts sleep.
  • Excess sugar spikes insulin levels, causing fatigue.
  • Additives in processed foods upset hormonal balance.
  • Alcohol worsens dehydration and sleep disruption.
  • Excess salt leads to bloating and hypertension risks.
  • Refined carbs contribute to weight gain and energy fluctuations.
  • A sedentary lifestyle reduces bone density and increases health risks.
  • Inadequate sleep exacerbates mood swings and energy levels.
  • Chronic stress increases cortisol levels, worsening mood and fatigue.
Chronic stress increases cortisol levels, worsening hormonal imbalance.

It's crucial to address these lifestyle factors to alleviate the symptoms of perimenopause and improve overall health.
newTitle: 10 Habits to Avoid for Better Management of Perimenopause

Inflammation in brain could affect behaviour based on sex, important for therapy, researchers say - ETHealthWorld
summary:
Inflammation in brain could affect behaviour based on sex, important for therapy, researchers say

Published On: Dec 27, 2024 | Source: PTI

New research indicates that sex-specific differences in behavior due to inflammation in the brain's hippocampus are significant for the treatment of neurological disorders, particularly emphasizing more severe symptoms in female mice.

  • Inflammation in the hippocampus can lead to symptoms like apathy and changes in food preferences.
  • These symptoms are generally more severe in women compared to men.
  • Neuroinflammation can influence wider brain activity affecting behavior.
  • Research suggests potential new therapies targeting neuroinflammation could help reduce symptoms in conditions such as Alzheimer’s disease and depression.
“While inflammation in the hippocampus is not solely responsible for behaviour changes, it likely triggers wider brain activity that influences behaviour.” - Laura Bradfield

This study underscores the necessity of considering sex differences in the development of therapies for neurological disorders, paving the way for advancements in treatment.
newTitle: Inflammation in Brain Affects Behavior by Sex: Importance for Therapy

title: How to use eggs to stop hair thinning - The Times of India
Which infectious disease is likely to be the biggest emerging problem in 2025? - Down To Earth Magazine
summary:
Which infectious disease is likely to be the biggest emerging problem in 2025?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Conversation

The article discusses the concerns of public health officials regarding emerging infectious diseases in 2025, focusing on influenza A subtype H5N1, commonly known as bird flu, and its potential to affect humans.

  • The three main infectious diseases currently of concern are malaria, HIV, and tuberculosis, collectively causing around 2 million deaths annually.
  • Influenza A subtype H5N1 is widely spread in birds and has recently started infecting dairy cattle and horses.
  • There have been 61 human cases of bird flu in the US this year, a rise compared to previous years.
  • Bird flu has a 30% mortality rate among human infections but does not transmit easily between humans.
  • Research indicates that a mutation could allow H5N1 to spread between humans, which would pose a significant risk.
  • Governments, including the UK, are preparing by stockpiling vaccines against bird flu.
“By understanding and preventing disease in our environment and the animals around us, we can better prepare and combat those diseases entering humans.” - Conor Meehan

In conclusion, while there are concerns about bird flu becoming a significant human health threat, current measures and understanding can aid in prevention and preparation for potential outbreaks.
newTitle: The Potential Emerging Infectious Disease Threats by 2025

7 fruits you should have with their skin on - India.com
summary:
7 Fruits You Should Eat with Their Skin On

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: India.com

This article highlights seven fruits that are more nutritious when consumed with their skins, detailing the health benefits associated with each fruit's skin.

  • Pears: The skin contains most of the fruit’s fiber and antioxidants, promoting gut health and reducing inflammation.
  • Apples: The skin is rich in fiber, antioxidants, and vitamins, which aid digestion and boost immunity.
  • Plums: Plum skin contains antioxidants and fiber that aid digestion and fight free radicals.
  • Cherries: The skin is loaded with anthocyanins, which reduce inflammation and improve heart health.
  • Kiwis: Kiwi skin is rich in fiber, vitamin C, and antioxidants, boosting overall health.
  • Grapes: The skin is packed with resveratrol, an antioxidant that supports heart health and reduces aging effects.
  • Peaches: The skin is high in antioxidants and fiber, aiding digestion and improving skin health.
Eating fruit with its skin can significantly increase nutrient intake and health benefits.

Incorporating these fruits into your diet with the skin can enhance your overall health and wellbeing.
newTitle: 7 Fruits You Should Eat with Their Skin On

title: University of Surrey shares list of what to eat & avoid during exams - Hindustan Times
summary:
University of Surrey Advises Students on Healthy Eating During Exams

Publication Date: December 27, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The University of Surrey has released guidelines for students on what to eat and what to avoid in order to maintain health and concentration during exam periods. This advice seeks to help students perform at their best.

  • Eat proper meals with slow-releasing carbohydrates to fuel study sessions.
  • Stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water throughout the day.
  • Incorporate a variety of fruits and vegetables in your diet over junk food.
  • Be mindful of caffeine intake to avoid dehydration and sleep disturbances.
  • Avoid high-sugar energy drinks as they can be detrimental to nutrition.
  • Limit indulgence in fatty foods and sugary snacks.
  • Monitor alcohol consumption as it can impact sleep and concentration.
“Drinking too much alcohol dehydrates you, disrupts your sleep, and can wreck your concentration the next day.”

In conclusion, making informed dietary choices during exams can significantly enhance academic performance and overall well-being for students.
newTitle: University of Surrey Advises Students on Healthy Eating During Exams

10 tips to make a healthy Pizza at home - Recipes
summary:
10 Tips for Making Healthy Pizza at Home

Date: Dec 27, 2024

Source: TimesOfIndia.com

Pizza is a widely loved dish, but traditional recipes often come loaded with calories, unhealthy fats, and refined carbohydrates. The good news is that you can enjoy pizza without guilt by making healthier choices at home. Here are 10 tips to make a healthy and delicious pizza at home.

  • Choose a whole grain or alternative crust.
  • Lighten up cheese with lower-fat options.
  • Load up on colorful vegetables like bell peppers, onions, and spinach.
  • Go lean on your proteins, using chicken or plant-based options.
  • Make homemade pizza sauce with fresh ingredients.
  • Practice portion control with smaller or shared pizzas.
  • Add fresh herbs and spices for flavor without calories.
  • Use a thin-crust to reduce calorie intake.
  • Bake instead of frying your pizza.
  • Control the amount of oil you use on your pizza.
“Enjoy pizza without guilt by making healthier choices at home.”

By following these tips, you can enjoy a delicious pizza experience that's both satisfying and healthy!
newTitle: 10 Tips for Making Healthy Pizza at Home

title: Frozen veg, spices, stews: Experts share tips to embrace winter food - Euronews
summary:
Frozen veg, spices, stews: Experts share tips to embrace winter food

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Culinary Nutrition Experts

With winter settling in across Europe, dieticians and food experts suggest it's a perfect time to explore underappreciated seasonal produce and to enjoy cooking for loved ones.

Key Points:

  • Winter is an ideal season to experiment with a variety of ingredients.
  • Mix fresh, frozen, canned, and dried products to enhance nutritional value.
  • Focus on seasonal produce, particularly citrus fruits and root vegetables.
  • Stews, soups, and porridges are versatile meal options that can incorporate various ingredients.
  • Herbs and spices can elevate flavors while providing health benefits.
  • Sharing meals can alleviate feelings of isolation during the winter months.
“Embrace the cold, embrace the winter and appreciate the bounty.” - Kristen Rasmussen

In conclusion, experts encourage individuals to make the most of winter's offerings by using creative cooking methods, sharing food with others, and experimenting with new flavors.
